Class Hero

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.geom.RectangularShape
      • java.awt.geom.Rectangle2D
        • java.awt.geom.Rectangle2D.Double
          • MovingImage
            • Hero
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.Shape, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable

    public class Hero
extends MovingImage
    The Hero class represents the playable main character which can move and use special abilities. Base code credit: Mr. Shelby from AnimationDemo.
    Version:
    5.23.21
    Author:
    vicram_vijayakumar
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • Hero

        public Hero(processing.core.PImage img,
            int x,
            int y)
        Creates a new instance of a Hero object having its left corner at the inputed (x, y) coordinates.
        Parameters:
        img - The PImage which the Hero will look like in the game (sprite).
        x - The X value of the Hero's top left corner.
        y - The Y value of the Hero's top left corner.

      • act

        public void act(java.util.ArrayList<java.awt.Shape> platforms,
                java.util.ArrayList<Enemy> enemies,
                java.util.ArrayList<Token> tokens,
                java.util.ArrayList<Spike> spikes,
                java.util.ArrayList<MovingPlatform> movingPlatforms)
        Makes the Hero act by moving, being affected by gravity and friction, and get hurt if attacked by enemy.
        Parameters:
        platforms - The platforms which the hero can stand on and interact with.
        enemies - The enemy which can attack the Hero and cause damage.
        tokens - The tokens.
        spikes - Spikes which deal damage
        movingPlatforms - moving platforms.

      • checkEnemyCollision

        public void checkEnemyCollision(Enemy e1)
        Makes the Hero lose a heart and jump up if it collides with an enemy. The Hero also gains some invinciblity for some time after it collides with an enemy.
        Parameters:
        e1 - The enemy which can attack the Hero and cause damage.

      • checkFireballCollision

        public void checkFireballCollision(java.util.ArrayList<Fireball> p)
        Checks whether the Hero gets hit by a Fireball. If so, the Hero loses health.
        Parameters:
        p - The list of Fireballs to check with

        public void setCheckpoint(double cx,
                          double cy)
        Sets the hero's checkpoint location
        Parameters:
        cx - The x coordinate of the checkpoint
        cy - The y coordinate of the checkpoint
